New Records: Mark Chapman scored an unbeaten 87 off 42 balls, including nine fours and four sixes
Key Match Events: The Black Caps chased down 179 with 10 balls to spare
Tim Robinson and Tim Seifert put on 42 for the opening partnership
Chapman and Dean Foxcroft then put on 117 for the third wicket
The game turned in their favour in the 15th and 16th overs when they managed to score 40 runs off two of Pakistan's most experienced bowlers
Pre-Game Insights: Black Caps youngsters urged to step up against Pakistan
Mark Chapman said the team knew Pakistan have a great attack and 178 was a chase-able score
Post-Match Reflections: Chapman said the way Siefert and Robinson set it up, they had a platform and they just tried to keep up with the rate
Miscellaneous Highlights: The fourth and fifth games are in Lahore next weekend
Others: The first T20 international between Pakistan and New Zealand in Rawalpindi has been abandoned due to rain
Pakistan bowled the inexperienced New Zealand side out for just 90 runs, and chased down the total in 12.1 overs
